Title:
The taxonomic position of the genus Heydenia (Pyronemataceae,
Pezizales) based on molecular and morphological data
Abstract:
Molecular and morphological data indicate that the genus
Heydenia is closely related to the cleistothecial Ascomycete Orbicula
(Pyronemataceae, Pezizales). Observations on the disposition and the
immediate surroundings of immature spores within the spore capsule
indicate that the Heydenia fruiting bodies are teleomorphs producing
early evanescent asci in stipitate cleistothecia. The once advocated
identity of Heydenia with Onygena is refuted on molecular grounds.
Onygena arietina E. Fischer is transferred to Heydenia.
